title: Ninety degrees south
brief_description: This famous film is the official record of Captain Scott’s last Expedition to the Antarctic in 1912. The film tells of the hazardous journey to the South and includes the last photographs of Scott, Evans, Wilson, and Oates, who were lost. In photographing this film, Herbert Ponting, “Camera Artist” to the Expedition, faced great hardships and narrowly escaped death on a number of occasions. 1934 soundtrack added to original silent documentary of 1912.
